Headline: Tokyo Stock Exchange Backups Fail
Impact - Raw: Server problems cause a 3.5-hour outage.

Headline: Knight Capital Loses $440 Million in Errant Trading Due to Programming Error
Impact - Raw: Losses place company at risk of collapse

Headline: Erroneous Trades Plunge India's National Stock Exchange 800 Points in Minutes
Impact - Raw: A trader entered 59 erroneous orders and the exchange stops to unravel orders.

Headline: NASDAQ Shuts Due to Trading Glitch
Impact - Raw: Exchange says for 3-hour outage was due to connectivity problems.

Headline: Computer Bought on eBay for £35 Contains 1 Million NatWest Bank Customer Records
Impact - Raw: Include names, addresses, mobile phone numbers, bank account numbers, sort codes, credit card numbers, mothers' maiden names and even signatures

Headline: 30 Million German Bank Cards' Date Problem Almost Fixed
Impact - Raw: The security chips didn't recognize date 2010.

Headline: Millions Affected by National Australia Bank Computer Problems
Impact - Raw: All personal and business accounts frozen for several days, transactions with other major Australian banks hit as well

Headline: 200,000 Credit and Debit Card Holders Doubled Billed by Lloyds Cardnet System
Impact - Raw: Charges happened New Year's Eve 2010.

Headline: Allied Irish Banks Sues for €84 Million over Botched Retail Banking System
Impact - Raw: Suit brought against Oracle

Headline: Computer Problems at Japan's Mizuho Bank Continued into Second Week
Impact - Raw: Millions of financial transactions delayed for processing for a week, ATMs closed for 3 days

Headline: National Australia Bank Suffers Another Computer Problem
Impact - Raw: Millions of Australians were affected again.

Headline: Korea's NH Bank Computers Crash
Impact - Raw: 30 Million account holders were affected for days.

Headline: Corrupt File at Australia's Westpac Bank Causes Problems for Australian Banks
Impact - Raw: Millions of banking customers across Australia affected for two days

Headline: Maintenance Issue Takes Down UK RBS and NatWest's Online and Telephone Banking Systems
Impact - Raw: 15 Million customers affected

Headline: IT Problem Takes Down UK HSBC's Online Banking and ATM System
Impact - Raw: 15 Million customers affected

Headline: Software Update Crashes UK RBS Bank Group IT Systems, Over 6 Million Customers Without Access to Accounts
Impact - Raw: System outage also hits banks and their customers across UK

Headline: Bank Blames GPS Error for Repossessing Wrong House
Impact - Raw: Bank apologizes and offers small compensation for error

Headline: UK RBS Bank Group Fined by Financial Conduct Authority £ 56 Million over 2012 IT Outages
Impact - Raw: RBS already paid out £ 175 Million in compensation and other costs, and is investing £1 Billion to improve internal IT

Headline: Dutch Tax Office Accidentally Erases 730,000 Digitally Submitted Tax Returns
Impact - Raw: Taxpayers must resubmit their returns.

Headline: Veterans Affairs Failure to Update Software Shortchanges War Widows for 12 years
Impact - Raw: 400,000 widows are owed money.

Headline: California Unemployment System Programming Issues Delay Checks
Impact - Raw: 117,000 unemployment checks were not sent out.

Headline: UK HMRC Agency Computer System Errors Hit 100,000 Taxpayers
Impact - Raw: The tax agency claimed the system was working as it should.

Headline: UK Government Tries to Quell Firestorm over Incorrectly Computed Taxes for 13.5 Million Taxpayers
Impact - Raw: HMRC computer system modernization to blame.

Headline: Tax Refunds for Over 600,000 H&R Block Users Delayed Because of eFile Problems
Impact - Raw: Refunds were delayed up to 8 weeks.

Headline: South Carolina Fires HP Over Failed Child Support Enforcement IT System
Impact - Raw: Complicated - best estimate is at least $116 million and probably tens of millions more over time as Federal fines mount

Headline: Massachusetts Department of Revenue Cancels New $114 Million Tax System Development
Impact - Raw: The state cancels its contract with Deloitte for poor performance after spending $54 Million.

Headline: North Carolina Cancels Tax Computer System Project After Spending $90.8 Million
Impact - Raw: The state will go in another direction.

Headline: UK £1.2 Billion Universal Credit Programme Begins Again
Impact - Raw: Program complete date pushed back to 2017 from 2015; £425m spent on the program so far likely to be written off

Headline: Indiana's Bureau of Motor Vehicles Overcharged 180,000 Customers over Ten Years
Impact - Raw: The state promises to refund $29 Million (plus interest) in wrongly calculated excise tax fees.

Headline: Ontario's New CN$240 Million Social Assistance Management Systems (SAMS) Overpays 17,000 Social Welfare Recipients Some CN$20 Million
Impact - Raw: Government calls overpayment a minor glitch

Headline: South Carolina and HP Agree Over Failed 2013 Child Support Project
Impact - Raw: HP agrees to pay SC $44 Million; SC Carolina Agrees to Pay HP $5 million; State still has to pay Feds $73 Million for not having Child Support System in place ($51 million was previously paid by computre companies who failed to build system); SC has hired Xerox to build system which won't be done by 2019; Congress in 1988 mandated system be in place by 1992

Headline: Ontario's Admits it May Take Another 10 Weeks to Fix Problems with  Social Assistance Management Systems (SAMS)
Impact - Raw: Over CN$5 Million spent on extra staff so far to fix on-going problems with system

Headline: Ontario's Admits More Time Fix Problems with  Social Assistance Management Systems (SAMS)
Impact - Raw: A total of CN$21 Million was spent to fix on-going problems with system on top of the original CN$242 million spent to develop it.
